dcterms:creator: G. W. Hill
dcterms:description: Hill's reference frame is used to represent the location of each spacecraft in the context of a multi-agent spacecraft inspection problem.
dcterms:title: Hill's reference frame

dcterms:creator: W. Clohessy
R. Wiltshire
dcterms:description: The Clohessy-Wiltshire equations describe the linearized relative motion dynamics between a deputy spacecraft and a chief spacecraft.
dcterms:title: Clohessy-Wiltshire equations

dcterms:creator: K. L. Hobbs
dcterms:description: Safety constraints based on position and velocity are defined to ensure that deputy spacecraft do not collide with the chief spacecraft or each other.
dcterms:title: Safety constraints based on position and velocity

dcterms:creator: K. L. Hobbs
A. R. Collins
E. M. Feron
dcterms:description: Risk-based formal requirement elicitation is utilized for automatic spacecraft maneuvering to ensure safety during operations.
dcterms:title: Risk-based formal requirement elicitation

dcterms:creator: K. Dunlap
M. Hibbard
M. Mote
K. Hobbs
dcterms:description: This dataset compares different run time assurance approaches for safe spacecraft docking.
dcterms:title: Comparing run time assurance approaches

dcterms:creator: M. Hibbard
U. Topcu
K. Hobbs
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on guaranteeing safety via active-set invariance filters for multi-agent space systems with coupled dynamics.
dcterms:title: Guaranteeing safety via active-set invariance filters

dcterms:creator: M. L. Mote
C. W. Hays
A. Collins
E. Feron
K. L. Hobbs
dcterms:description: Natural motion-based trajectories are developed for automatic spacecraft collision avoidance during proximity operations.
dcterms:title: Natural motion-based trajectories for automatic spacecraft collision avoidance
